content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is on the phone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mom, would you relax. That was 10 blocks from here and, the, the woman was walking alone at night, I would never do that. Mom, c’mon, stop worrying. This is a safe street, this is a safe building, there’s nothing (a pigeon flies in the window and lands on the table) Oh my Goood , oh my God, oh I gotta go, I gotta go, I gotta go. (hangs up) OK, that’s fine, you just read the paper, I’m gonna get a pot, it’s not for you. (grabs a pot and lid) OK, that’s fine, read the Family Circus , enjoy the gentle comedy. (puts pot over the pigeon) Aaahh, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, aaaaahh. (knock at the door) It’s open you guys.
(a stranger enters with flowers)

content.speaker: Stranger
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, hi can I help you?

content.speaker: Stranger
content.text: Yeah, I’m looking for Phoebe, does she still live here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, no she doesn’t but I can, I can get a message to her.

content.speaker: Stranger
content.text: Great. Uhh, just tell her her husband stopped by. (leaves flowers on bar)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? (in surprise she forgets she has the pigeon in the pot and lets it get away)

content.speaker: Stranger
content.text: Hey, how, how did you do that?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the whole gang is there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is unbelievable Phoebs, how can you be married?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I mean, I’m not married , married, ya know, he’s just a friend and he’s gay and he’s just from Canada and he just needed a green card.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you married Duncan. I mean how could you not tell me? We lived together, we told each other everything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry Monica but I knew if I told you, you’d get really, like, judgemental and you would not approve.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course I wouldn’t approve, I mean, you were totally in love with this guy who, hello, was gay. I mean, what the hell were you thinking?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You see, and you thought she’d be judgemental.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, I wasn’t in love with him and I was just helping out a friend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please, when he left town you stayed in your pajamas for a month and I saw you eat a cheeseburger.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Huuh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, didn’t you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I might have.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you didn’t tell me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, c’mon, like you tell me everything.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What have I not told you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I don’t know. Umm, how about the fact that the underwear out there on the telephone pole is yours from when you were having sex with Fun Bobby out on the terrace.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What!
(Rachel, Joey, Ross, and Phoebe run over to the window to look.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute, who told you? (turns to Chandler who’s looking sheepish) You are dead meat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I didn’t know it was a big secret.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh it’s not big, not at all, you know, kinda the same lines as, say, oh I don’t know, having a third nipple!
(Everyone comes back from the window and surrounds Chandler with Ross hopping on the couch.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You have a third nipple?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You bitch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whip it out, whip it out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: C’mon, there’s nothin’ to see, it’s just a tiny bump, it’s totally useless.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh as, as opposed to your other multi-functional nipples?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe you. You told me it was a nubbin.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, what did you think a nubbin was?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, you see somethin’, you hear a word, I thought that’s what it was. Let me see it again.
(They go over to Chandler.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah, show it. Show it. The nubbin, the nubbin, the nubbin.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey was in a porno movie.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Huuh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If I’m goin’ down, I’m takin’ everybody with me.
(They all run over to Joey.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You were in a porno?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh, alright, alright, alright, I was young and I just wanted a job, OK. But at the last minute I couldn’t go through with it so they let me be the guy who comes in to fix the copier but can’t ’cause there’s people havin’ sex on it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is wild.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So what’s it shaped like?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, is there a hair on it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What happens if you flick it?

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, and Julie are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, uh, does it do anything, you know, special?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why yes Ross, pressing my third nipple opens the delivery entrance to the magical land of Narnia.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: You know, in some cultures having a third nipple is actually a sign of virility. You get the best huts and women dance naked around you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh? Are, uh, any of these cultures, per chance, in the tri-state area?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know, you are so amazing, is there anything you, you don’t know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, Julie’s so smart, Julie’s so special.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look honey, I wanted you to hook up with Ross as much as you did. But he’s with her now and you’re just gonna have to get over it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, I’m gonna have to get over it. God, see I didn’t know that’s I had to do, I just have to get over it.
(Phoebe enters all dressed up)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Woah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Foxy lady.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Where you goin’?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, I’m gonna go meet Duncan, he’s skating tonight at the Garden, he’s in the Capades.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The Ice Capades?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no the gravel capades. Yeah, the turns aren’t as fast but when Snoopy falls… funny.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you’re dressing up for him. I mean, you’re just, you’re setting yourself up all over again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, no. For your information I’m going to see him so I can put all those feeling behind me. OK, and the reason I’m dressed like this is because I think it’s nice to look nice for your gay husband.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, darnit, we’re all out of milk. (holds pitcher in front of Chandler’s chest and flips the lid) Hey Chandler, would you fill me up here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh I see, I see, because of the third nipple thing. Ha ha ha ha…

content.description: Central Perk, close to closing. Ross and Julie are still there. Rachel is cleaning tables.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK sweetie, I’ll see you later.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: See you later Rach.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye-bye Julie. (Julie leaves)
(Rachel is still cleaning, Ross is laying on the couch. Ross kicks Rachel in the butt.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.
(Ross kicks her again)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, c’mon, cut it out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can I ask you somethin’?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Naa.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? C’mon, talk to me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, what’s the longest you’ve been in the relationship before ha, have, having the sex?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why? Who’s not having… Are you and Julie not, are, are you and, are you and Julie not having sex?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Technically, huh, no.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow. Is it, is it ’cause she’s so cold in bed. Or, or is it ’cause she’s like, kinda bossy, makes it feel like school?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, she’s great and it’s not like we haven’t done anything. I mean, uh, uh, we, we do plenty of other stuff, lot’s of other stuff, like uhh…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no no no, don’t need to know the details.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s just, it’s, it’s me. You, you know I’ve only been with one woman my whole life and she turned out to be a lesbian. So now I’ve got myself all psyched out, you know, and it’s become, like this, this thing and I… Well, you just must think I’m weird.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, no, no I don’t think it’s weird, I think, I think umm, in fact, in fact you know what I think?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I think it’s sexy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sexy?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let me tell you something. As a woman there is nothing sexier than a man who does not want to have sex.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No kidding?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah. In fact you know what I’d do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’d wait.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’d wait?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, absolutely. I would wait and wait… then I’d wait some more.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, I don’t care how much she tells you she wants it, I don’t care if begs, she pleads, she tells you she, she’s gonna have sex with, with another man. That just means it’s working.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Women really want this?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: More than jewelry. (Rachel struts off, extremely pleased with herself)

content.description: Madison Square Garden, Duncan’s dressing room.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ta-da.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Ahh, look at you, you look great.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Do I? Thank you, so do you.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sparkly. So, wow, this is pretty wonerful, huh. Mr. major capades guy. I, I remember when you were just, like, King Friday in Mr. Roger’s Ice is Nice.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: You always said I’d make it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, well, ya know, I’m kind of spooky that way. Wooo.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: I missed you. (they hug) I’m gonna get changed.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Um, now. Phoebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, right, OK. Ole.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, the matador. (Duncan leaves) Ole, ha ha ha.

content.description: Ross’s apartment. Ross and Julie are setting the table.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Julie, can you hold this for a second, thanks. (hands her a bowl and kisses her)
(Chandler, Monica, Joey, and Rachel enter. Ross and Julie don’t notice.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, Julie.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sorry, you had a paleontologist on your face. But, uh, it’s gone now, you’re alright.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi everyone.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just, I wanted to thank you for our uh, our little talk before.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, God, no problem. So you’re gonna go with the uh, waiting thing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I was going to, but after I talked to you, I talked to Joey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What did, what did he say?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Basically he told me to get over myself and just do it, ya know. So I though about what you said and I though about what he said and, well, his way I get to have sex tonight so…

content.description: Ross’s apartment, after dinner. Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s this in my pocket? Why it’s Joey’s porno movie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pop it in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m fine with it, I mean, if you’re OK watching a video filled with two nippled people. (Chandler puts the tape in)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Great, people having sex, that’s just what I need to see.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s wrong with people having sex?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, well um, you know, these movies are offensive and uh, degrading to women and females. And uh, and the lighting’s always unflattering. And, Monica help me out here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hell, I wanna see Joey.
(The video starts with the cheesy porn disco music)

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: So is there like a story or do they just stard doing it right… oh, never mind.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, now wait a minute. That is the craziest typing test I’ve ever seen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All I say is, she better get the job.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Looks to me like he’s the one getting the job.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Shh, OK, here I come, here I come. See I’m comin’ to fix the copier, I can’t get to the copier, I’m thinkin’ what do I do, what do I do… so I just watch ’em have sex. And then I say, wait, here’s my line, (Joey from TV) you know that’s bad for the paper tray .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nice work my friend.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you. Wait wait wait wait, you see me again. Hang on, the guy’s butt’s blockin’ me. There I am, there I am, there I am, there I am, there I am…

content.description: Madison Square Garden, Duncan’s dressing room. Phoebe is fixing her hair and Duncan enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So um, so what’s up, you came to see me yesterday.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Oh, yeah, um, alright, I kinda need a divorce.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh…K. How come?

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Umm, actually, I’m getting married again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Oh God, I don’t know how to tell you this. I’m straight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huuh.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Yeah, I know, I.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I, I don’t, I don’t understand, how can you be straight? I mean, you’re, you’re so smart and funny and you throw such great Academy Award parties.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: I know, that’s what I kept telling myself but you just reach a point where you can’t live a lie anymore.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So how long have you known?

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Well I guess on some level I always knew I was straight. I though I was supposed to be something else, you know, I’m an ice dancer, all my friends are gay, I was just tryin’ to fit in.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And um, and there’s actually a, a woman?

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Her name’s Debra.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Well is she, is she the first that you’ve been with?

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: Well, I’ve never told you this but, there were one or two times, back in college, when I’d get really drunk, go to a straight bar and wake up with a woman next to me. But I, I, I told myself it was the liquor and e-everyone experiments in college.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: But now I know I don’t have a choice about this, I was born this way.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I, I don’t know what to say. I mean, you know, you’re married to someone for six years and you think you know him and then one day says, ‘Oh, I’m not gay.’

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: I’m, I’m still me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why couldn’t you have just figured this out six years ago?

content.description: Ross’s apartment, everyone is sitting around. Monica enters from bathroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, it still smells like monkey in there.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: That saves us a conversation.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, listen, this has been great but I’m officially wiped.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too, we should get goin’.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, I mean, no, c’mon you guys, I mean, c’mon look it’s only eleven thirty. Let’s just talk, we never just hang out and talk anymore.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, that’s all we do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Maybe that’s all we do, what about Julie?

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: What about Julie?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you have been in our lives for nearly two months now and we don’t really know you. I mean, who is Julie? I mean, what do you like, what don’t you like? We wanna hear everything.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Well, that could take a while.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So. I mean, who here does not have the time to get to know Julie?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I got the time to get to know Julie.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I got time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, I know her pretty well, can I go? (Rachel gives her a look from hell) That’s fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK Julie, so now let’s start with your childhood, what was that like?

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: Well, in a nutshell…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nah, uh, uh, uh, uh.

content.description: Madison Square Garden, Duncan’s dressing room. Phoebe is signing the divorce papers.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, um, have you told your parents?

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: No, but it’ll be OK, they’re pretty cool, my brother’s straight so…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Here you go. You know what, I just have one more question, um, if you had figured this out sooner and um, I had been around, do you think that I would have been the one who… no, um, I’m sorry, don’t tell me, I don’t think either answer would make me feel better.

content.speaker: Duncan
content.text: I love you Phoebe. (they hug and kiss)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So your brother’s straigh huh? Seriously.

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Julie is telling her life story.

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: And my second grade teacher was Ms. Thomas, and my first grade teacher was Mrs. Cobb.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mrs., Mrs. Gobb?

content.speaker: Julie
content.text: No Cobb, as in cobb salad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now, what exactly is in a cobb salad?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m goin’ home.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?
(Outside in the hallway, Chandler, Joey, and Monica exit)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Boy that Julie’s a talker, huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good-night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, it’s pretty late, you’re probably uh, not still planning on…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no-no, I am.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well, are hey, are you nervous?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um, no, I uh, I have done it before.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, OK, I mean uh, what, how are you gonna handle it. I mean, are, are ya gonna, are ya gonna talk about it before hand, are you just gonna pounce?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I uh, I don’t know, I guess I’m just gonna see, see what happens.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, gook luck.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha, uhh, what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nothing, I mean, um, it is your first time with her and, you know if the first time doesn’t go well, well then that’s, that’s pretty darn hard to recover from.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, now I’m nervous.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Maybe you should put it off.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, I don’t wanna put it off, I just, God I just, I spent last year being so unbelievably miserable, ya know, and now, now I’m actually happy. You know, I mean, really happy. I just, I just don’t wanna, I don’t wanna mess it up, ya know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, yeah, sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, it’s not your fault.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Maybe it, maybe it doesn’t have to be this tough. I mean, maybe you were on the right track with this whole, you know, spontaneous thing. I mean, women really like that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I mean, you know it, I mean, if it were me I, I, you know, I’d want you to, I don’t know, like catch me off guard, you know, with like a really good kiss, you know really, sort of um, soft at first, then maybe um brush the hair away from my face, and look far into my eyes in a way that let’s me know that something amazing is about to happen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh.
content.parenthetical: being drawn in by her talk

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And then, I don’t know, I mean you’d pull me really close to you so that, so that I’d be pressed up, you know, right against you. And, um, it would get kind of sweaty and uh, and blurry, and then it’s just happening.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh… Thanks Rach, goodnight. (goes back in apartment)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, God.

content.description: [Scene: A Street, the next morning. Ross is dancing along, Singing in the Rain is playing. Two old ladies are sitting on a bench.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good morning.

content.speaker: Old Woman
content.text: somebody got some last night.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Twice
